Cuerpo: Date: Tue, 26 Nov 1996 19:17:15 GMT Server: Apache/1.1.1 Content-type: text/html Content-length: 3644 Last-modified: Thu, 10 Oct 1996 23:28:45 GMT Cis 410/510 Object Oriented Analysis/Design Cis 410/510 Object Oriented Analysis/Design Note: This page is still under construction, so bear with me... For people who don't know Java, we have an on-line tutorial . Syllabus week 1 Introduction to the course. The second class will consider Fusion: A Software Development Method (Coleman, et. Groups are to be formed during this week. week 2 Systems analysis. This week is devoted to understanding Object and Interface models, with consideration given to the process of analysis and the analysis cycle (Coleman, et. The process of analysis will be divided into three class periods. Week 3 Systems design and first presentation. Selected groups will be asked to depict the analysis required and undertaken for their first project. Week 4 Continuation of Systems Design. The first class considers Class Descriptions and Class Categories, while the second considers Inheritance Graphs (Coleman pp87-100). Selected groups will be asked to explain the system design of their first project. The final class features performance, scoping reviews, and implementation (pp.120-143). All materials are due for the first project following class on the 8th. Week 8 Topics important to the management of a fusion project (Ch 10) are discussed first to complete the readings from the text. And "Happy Turkey Day!" Week 10 Topics important to ComponentWare and Agents are considered this final week. One of the topics you will be asked to consider is how to design a Summary Information File (SIF) for each component of a software design. All materials for the second project are due following the final presentations. Maintainer of this page: Bjørn S. Fjeld Pettersen email: bjorn@cs.uoregon.edu
